TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi ADODC extends System.Windows.Forms.UserControl implements class msdatasrc.DataSource

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")

Docs.summary: Provides compatibility with the Visual Basic 6.0 , which enabled you to create a connection to a database using Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects ().

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this control in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0 to continue to use an `ADO` data connection. For new development, you should consider using `ADO.NET` instead of `ADO`. For more information, see [Comparison of ADO.NET and ADO](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/98f2c0cd-437d-4934-8be5-c174b6782cae).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Provides compatibility with the Visual Basic 6.0 `ADO Data Control`.

They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public newslot virtual instance void addDataSourceListener(class msdatasrc.DataSourceListener dsl) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds an interface to monitor changes in a data set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `DataSourceListener` monitors a data set for data members that are added, removed, or changed when the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC> is connected to a data source.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color for a .
Docs.value: A that represents the background color of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting the `BackColor` property affects only the part of the control where text is displayed.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current row position is before the first row in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A>.
Docs.value: if the current row position is before the first row; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `BOF` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF%2A> return values are determined by the location of the current row pointer if this pointer is valid. If either `BOF` or <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF%2A> is `true`, there is no current row, and any attempt to reference <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> data causes an exception.
You can use the `BOF` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF%2A> properties to determine whether an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> object contains rows or whether you have gone beyond the limits of an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> as you move from row to row.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates what action the takes when the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF%2A> property is .
Docs.value: A <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOFActionEnum> enumeration that specifies the action to take.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to specify the behavior when the `MovePrevious` button is pressed and the first row of a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> is the current row.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of records that are cached in local memory for the current <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A>.
Docs.value: An that specifies the number of records that are cached in local memory for the current <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> object. The default is 50 records.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `CacheSize` value tells the provider how many records to keep in its buffer and how many records to fetch at one time to local memory. For example, when set to 10, after opening the first <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A>, the provider fetches the first 10 records into local memory. Therefore, as you move forward from the current record, the provider returns the data values from the local memory buffer. As soon as you move past the last record, the next 10 records are fetched from the data source into the cache.
While you can change value during the life of the cursor, the change only affects the number of records in the cache after the next fetch from the data source.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the duration, in seconds, that the waits for a command to return from the server.
Docs.value: An that specifies the number of seconds to wait when a connection is being established. The default is 15 seconds.

remarks.format:
## Remarks After this period of time has elapsed without completing the command, the provider raises an exception to the calling application and cancels the command.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that informs the what type of command to pass when opening a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A>.
Docs.value: A enumeration that specifies the command type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property optimizes the execution of the command.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets of sets the information that is used to establish a connection to a data source.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the connection information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the `ConnectionString` property to specify a data source by passing a detailed connection string that contains a series of argument = value statements separated by semicolons.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the duration of time, in seconds, for which the provider attempts to connect to the server specified in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.ConnectionString%2A> property.
Docs.value: An that specifies the number of seconds to wait when a connection is being established. The default is 15 seconds.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property corresponds to the ADO `ConnectionTimeout` property.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. Docs.summary: Gets or sets the location of the cursor library for the object.
Docs.value: A enumeration that specifies s the location. The default is .

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the default type of cursor to use when opening a result set from the specified query.
Docs.value: A enumeration that specifies the type of cursor to use.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by a and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the disposing parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with the disposing parameter set to `false`.
When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this control references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: The event is called when there is an attempt to move to a row past the end of the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An `EndOfRecordset` event may occur if the `MoveNext` operation fails.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF%2A> and `EOF` return values are determined by the location of the current row pointer if this pointer is valid. If either <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF%2A> or `EOF` is `true`, there is no current row, and any attempt to reference <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> data causes an exception.
You can use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF%2A> and `EOF` properties to determine whether an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> object contains rows or whether you have gone beyond the limits of an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> as you move from row to row.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of concurrency handling.
Docs.value: A enumeration that specifies the type of concurrency handling.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In order to maintain sufficient control over the data being updated, `ADO` provides a number of concurrency options that control how other users are granted, or refused access to the data being updated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnResize(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The `OnResize` method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a will be oriented horizontally (the default) or vertically.
Docs.value: A <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.OrientationEnum> enumeration that specifies the orientation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property corresponds to the `ADO``Recordset``MaxRecords` property.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Sets the password that is used during the creation of an ADO object.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the password.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property setting is write-only. It may only be provided in code, it cannot be read back from the `Password` property.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. ## Remarks The user-name syntax depends on the data source. When a `UserName` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Password%2A> are supplied, the control uses the values to create a connection string (<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.ConnectionString%2A> property).
